metadata.title: Combined use of A/D converter and D/A converter

sections.content:
Question:
When using the A/D converter, is there any problem to change the analog output of D/A converter?
Answer:
If A/D converter and D/A converter do not have the same analog power supply inside the MCU, changing the analog outputwill not matter.
However, when the analogue power supply is shared, do not perform D/A conversion because the rush current at D/A conversion may affect A/D conversion accuracy.
In addition, for D/A converters that have countermeasures against interference with analog modules, if this function is enabled, D/A conversion is not performed during A/D conversion. This reduces A/D conversion accuracy degradation due to interference.
To check whether the analogue power supply is the same or not, and also to check if the interference-prevention measures are taken for the analogmodule, refer to A/D Converter section, D/A Converter section, and Pin Functions of Overview section in the User’s Manual: Hardware.

RX Family
